title: On the Relationship between the Uniqueness of the Moonshine Module and Monstrous Moonshine
abstract:
We consider the relationship between the conjectured uniqueness of the Moonshine Module, ${\cal V}^
atural$, and Monstrous Moonshine, the genus zero property of the modular invariance group for each Monster group Thompson series. We first discuss a family of possible $Z_n$ meromorphic orbifold constructions of ${\cal V}^
atural$ based on automorphisms of the Leech lattice compactified bosonic string. We reproduce the Thompson series for all 51 non-Fricke classes of the Monster group $M$ together with a new relationship between the centralisers of these classes and 51 corresponding Conway group centralisers (generalising a well-known relationship for 5 such classes). Assuming that ${\cal V}^
atural$ is unique, we then consider meromorphic orbifoldings of ${\cal V}^
atural$ and show that Monstrous Moonshine holds if and only if the only meromorphic orbifoldings of ${\cal V}^
atural$ give ${\cal V}^
atural$ itself or the Leech theory. This constraint on the meromorphic orbifoldings of ${\cal V}^
atural$ therefore relates Monstrous Moonshine to the uniqueness of ${\cal V}^
atural$ in a new way.
